titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thall and Lopez family papers and photographs CBHM.0022
titlestmt.author: Dee Bowers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-01-23 17:14:51 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Thall and Lopez family papers and photographs
did.abstract: Documents, ephemera and photographs relating to several generations of the Thall and Lopez families of Canarsie, Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The documents are grouped into folders by family member or topic and arranged roughly chronologically. The photographs and ephemera are foldered separately.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Lt. Col. William Augustus Greene was born in Manhattan in 1840 and moved to Brooklyn at age 8, where he then resided for the rest of his life. He was a descendant of Robert Morris, a signer of the Declaration of Independence. He served in the United States Civil War as a member of the 173rd Regiment of New York Volunteers, during which he was wounded and captured multiple times. In 1872, he married Jane Williams (1847-1918), daughter of Charles Williams and Jane Vanderwenk. William and Jane Greene resided at 178 Clymer Street in South Williamsburg. William passed away in 1911.

Their daughter Jennie Greene (1873-1943) married Dr. Charles Sewell Thall (1872-1923) in 1901. Charles was the son of Richard Thall (1835-1905). The Thalls lived at 1122 East 92nd Street in Canarsie. Their son Sewell was born in 1906. Their daughter Muriel (1904-1979) married Hampton Nottage (1908-1961) in 1934. She worked at New York Bell. The Thalls' other daughter Lorraine (b. 1904) became pregnant by Puerto Rican shipwelder Carlos Santos Lopez, and their son Donald was born July 15, 1923.

Donald S. Lopez Sr. volunteered for the Army Air Forces Aviation Cadet Program in early 1942, after becoming interested in aviation in childhood partially because of his family home's proximity to Floyd Bennett Field on Jamaica Bay. He served as a United States Air Force fighter and test pilot and saw combat in both World War II and the Korean War. He retired from the Air Force in 1964. He spent eight years as an engineer on the Apollo and Skylab programs with Bellcomm, Inc., a subsidiary of Bell Labs. In 1972, he joined the staff of the National Air and Space Museum and served as a deputy director there until his death in 2008. He is buried with full military honors at Arlington National Cemetery.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Thall and Lopez family papers and photographs, CBHM.0022, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: CBH holds many similar collections of family papers and photographs. In addition, these two collections contain some similar material as that in this collection:
United States, Confederate States, and foreign currency collection (1974.120)
Checks and receipts from Brooklyn businesses and institutions collection (CBHM.0014)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters, photographs, account ledgers, blue prints, wills, deeds, stock certificates, Civil War infantry manual, Civil War currency, notes, newspaper clippings, electrification contracts, assorted legal documents relating to the Thall and Lopez families of Canarsie, Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

did.unittitle: Charles and Jane Williams and Jane Williams Greene

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes documents related to his Civil War service (including Civil War currency) and his interment at Greenwood Cemetery.

did.unittitle: William A. Greene's copy of "Infantry tactics"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to ownership of the property, specifications for building and work on the house, and blueprint plans of architectural details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, documentation of New York Bell stocks, and a marriage certificate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents stock held in the Belle Harbor Yacht Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, genealogical charts and photocopied vital records connecting the Thall, Lopez, Greene and Williams family to the Brownells, O'Briens, Sewells and more. Traces the family lineage back to the Colonial period and beyond.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mostly tintypes. Named individuals include C. Fowler Brennan (1868), G. Brasted (1862), Isaac Henry John Lakin (1867). Also includes a tintype made into a brooch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tintypes and cabinet cards in a leather album with gilded embossing and metal clasps. Named individuals include Jane Vanderwenk Williams, Charles Williams, William Augustus Greene, Jane Williams Greene, and Jennie Greene Thall.
